question_text: What is the purpose of enabling virtualization support like Intel VT-x or AMD-V in the BIOS/UEFI?
answer_options: To increase battery life on laptops
To enable access to BIOS from a virtual machine
To improve performance and compatibility of virtual machines
To allow multiple CPUs to be installed
correct_answer: To improve performance and compatibility of virtual machines
explanation: Intel VT-x and AMD-V allow the CPU to better support virtual machines by providing hardware-assisted virtualization.
